DOC.brief_summary: Parallel, Multi-Center, Double-masked, Active controlled, three arm study comparing the IOP lowering efficacy and safety over 12 months of morning or evening instillations of Travoprost/Brinzolamide vs. Cosopt dosed in the morning and evening in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension.
DOC.brief_title: 1 Year Study Trav/Brinz QD Fixed Combination Versus COSOPT
DOC.criteria: IOP at screening visit <18mmHg in at least one eye Mean IOP in same eye (at both eligibility 1 &2 visits) 24 and ≤ 36 mmHg at 9:00 21 and ≤ 36 mmHg at 11:00 and 16:00 Severe central visual field loss Angle Shaffer grade < 2 C/D ratio > 0.8 (horizontal or vertical measurement)
DOC.keyword: Patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension
